greatxedge is love
brought to you by the isLove Generator
beautiful. do you ever think of things that you'd like to accomplish some day before you die, so you make a mental note? well, i decided a couple of weeks ago that my life goal is to write a nice, long fantasy epic. you know, with wizards and magic and elves and dragons, and every cliche' ever used in a fantasy epic will be included. and this isn't just a life goal like "one day i want to eat fifty hard boiled eggs without throwing up." this is the mother of all life goals. i haven't played d&d in quite a while, and i'm starting to go crazy. i NEED my d&d. i'm starting to get that itch behind my ear. you know the one. i think Sean is getting one together for Friday night, so i'm definitely looking forward to that. bababooey bababooey howard sterns penis bababooey. so i hopped on a bus oh yeah, it was 1950s style yeah, you got a reason to smile i won't see you for a while i hopped on a bus, baby i packed a blue duffle bag, too i packed it with all the mess you left from when you ran through

isn't stupid how dentists get all mad at you if they find a little bit of plaque on your teeth, or if your gums are a bit red? i'm just like, "dude, i don't know why you're so upset. you're getting paid!" tomorrow i'm off to Camp Weed for the weekend. i was actually supposed to go in September, i think, but it got cancelled because of those doggon hurricanes. tomorrow at my school's talent show, me and Lloyd are gonna perform "Turning Japanese" by the Vapors. we practiced it a bunch today and i think we got it down pat. score. guess who has a 3.1 GPA? me! why so sad when i look at you because i'm away i know i feel it too

sometimes it's really frustrating to see how seriously people take football. it's just a game, but a lot of people let the outcome affect their mood for the rest of the day. it sucks, especially when one of those people is my stepdad. he acts like a complete dick whenever FSU doesn't play so well. of course, being who i am, i can't resist making clever remarks about how much FSU sucks. he always blows up at me about the stupidest things. i'm just like, "yo Bob, chill out. it's just a game, and the sun will come out tomorrow." he usually responds with something manly, like, "shut up and eat your apple. i don't want to see your mouth moving unless you're chewing." i get quiet because i don't want to start anything. i wish my mom would tell him that he's out of line, but she never does.

eh.

it's the hardest thing to write a song for a girl when you're not just trying to impress her, but you're also trying to make it really mean something.

tomorrow night...can't wait.

on Saturday i watched "When Harry Met Sally" with Amy. at the end, when Billy Crystal is giving his speech that wins Meg Ryan over, he says, "and when you've found the person you want to spend the rest of your life with, you want the rest of your life to begin as soon as possible," or something like that. that came to my mind this morning while i was thinking about getting my own place, and getting a full-time job. it's like my grown up life, my future, has been set into motion.

i decided that after i finish at Lively, i'm gonna take a year off of school, get a full time job, and move into an apartment with Mike, Joey, and Chase. i really want to do some traveling, too. the two places i have in mind are Washington, DC, and San Francisco.

i told my parents about this. my mom is totally okay with it. Bob, on the other hand, told me that when he was my age, he had way more since than me, even though he was on dope. thanks Bob, i appreciate your support, drop-out.

the writer's block is back...again. i'm trying to write a song where the music and the words flow together and describe Amy so perfectly that you wouldn't have to know her or see a picture of her to know what she's like. it seems like everything i come up with just isn't pretty enough.

i think one day i'd like to go live in the mountains for a year, all by myself, and just see what kind of stuff i can write.

my last days at SAIL are coming soon.

<i>we would drag ourselves to bed
and sleep took everything i had
i kept it up 'til he would call
you make me feel like a criminal
and then there's you, you kept a smile
when i would always walk the wire
i gave you reason to have doubt 
i had to get out of there
i took the stairs
i don't want to fight with you
if i can't be the one to have you
you sat in that chair like a queen in the kitchen
i memorized the lines your eyes made
at every glance you shot my way
you're miserable and i'm useless
i'm always making up excuses
i made you cry too many times
so i'm hanging up that line
i'm throwing rocks at your floor
i'm knocking down your front door
i'm desparate tonight, and i just want to fight
it's my confusion that makes me act so cold
so now go, go, go
if you wanna be just left alone, put down that phone
but if you want me, just call out, "hey boy!"

Amy's out of town for the weekend. *sad face* i decided to put songs 22 and 23 on hold, and go back over songs 1 through 21 and streamline them. maybe add some stuff, maybe take it away. whichev. three days 'til GTA. i'll be fine without these bones

i'm happy with my life, just how it is. my songwriting is really improving. i have 21 songs that i'm happy with and would like to eventually record. i'm working on 22 and 23 right now. well, not right now, but you know... i need to find some people to jam with. the new GTA comes out on Tuesday, i'm so stoked. i've got my copy pre-ordered and everything. i guarantee that this is going to be one of the longest weeks of my life. promise me you'll still be mine

i totally saw this kid hit the curb with his bike and endo onto the side walk, complete with an "UHH!" that sounded like a combination of the sounds you make when you get kicked in the balls and get punched in the stomach. it totally made my life. that's it. don't waste your time on me you're already a voice inside my head

life is good. i thought for a little while that things were going to plummet to sucktitude, but it was a false alarm. D&D Friday, can't wait. they say to me, "don't be hanging on if you won't go on" do i want to? pray to see, pray to know provide for me i won't let it go life confuses me i can't find my way out of here i think i'd rather stay when do i begin to start? being to let you into my heart? why so sad when i look at you? because i'm away, i know i feel it too

it's funny. i haven't addressed her directly in quite a few days. come to think of it, it's been more than quite a few, but who's counting, anyway? only she could go from missing me terribly to hating me and back to missing me, all based on a misunderstanding in an old eljay entry.

you retard. didn't you ever stop for one second to consider that Katie was part of my life long before you were? just cut this stupid crap out and get on with your life. nobody feels sorry for you, and nobody cares about your stupid eyes.

i think my new favorite song is "Vapor Trail" by Ride. it's so pretty, especially the violin at the end.

today i went outside in my front yard and wrote a song, music and lyrics, and i'm really happy with it. a lot of times i get caught up in writing stuff that's really complex, but what i need to remember when i write is that sometimes, people just need to hear a simple, relaxing song to remind them that life need not be so complicated all the time. i think i'm going to play my song at talent show next Friday. 

i got my hair cut today. it's nice to have it short again.

he says, "i think you're pretty." so she thinks, "i wish i liked you." i've been having a real creative spree as of late. i'm writing a lot of songs, and i can definitely tell that my songwriting abilities are majorly improving. also, i'm actually writing lyrics. most of the time, i just write the music, and then scrap it because i can't think of any lyrics, but now i'm actually writing some pretty decent ones. they're not very deep or complex, but there are some good ones with some good melodies. i hope this continues for a while before i get another writers' block. i'm soooo close to having enough material for an album. speaking of which, i might be going to Nashville with my sister to record some stuff...that would rock. fighting feels so wrong.

i had a pretty decent birthday yesterday. everyone came over and ate some steak and cake, and i got some nice presents... -gift card to EB (from mom) -Goldenboy - Blue Swan Orchestra (from Bob) -Suffrajett - Self-titled (from Mary) -Murder Machine and Contract Killer (from Amy) -Kristen is too poor -The Sims 2 (from myself) then i took everyone to my grandma's house 'cause they had some more cake out there for me. i felt so special. after that, me and the guys went to X-mart (just because), then we went to Zack's apartment, but we had to leave because his fiance' was being a you-know-what. i arrived home to about a million plastic forks sticking up in my front yard...thanks Allyson. the man with two brains says, "you make no sense."

i'm not angry at all. you're the one that's angry because there's nothing you can do. you're angry at yourself.

and i AM cool. you're just jealous.

Copy and paste this to a comment and put an X by the ones that apply.

() go out with me?
() give me your number?
() have sex with me?
() let me kiss you?
() watch a movie with me...even a really sappy one?
() let me take you out to dinner?
() drive me somewhere/anywhere?
() take a shower with me?
() be my bf/gf?
() have a fling with me?
() listen to me if I called you crying even if you were out with all of your friends?
() buy me a drink if i didnt have money?
() take me home for the night?
() would you let me sleep in your bed?
() sing car kareoke w/ me?
() sit in the doctors office with me because I didn't want to go alone?
() re-post this for me to answer your questions?
() let me give you a piggyback ride?
() come pick me up at 3 am because my car ran out of gas in the middle of nowhere?

LAYER ONE: Name: Brandon Birth date: 9-26-86 Birthplace: Thomasville, Georgia Current Location: Tallahassee, FL Eye Color: Doo Doo Brown Hair Color: Brown Height: 5'10 Righty or Lefty: righty, but i shoot a rifle leftly Zodiac Sign: libra LAYER TWO: Your heritage: german, italian, cherokee The shoes you wore today: black lowtop cons Your weakness: money Your fears: spiders Your perfect pizza: never really thought about it Goal you'd like to achieve: be a teacher LAYER THREE: Your most overused phrase on AIM: "sweet" Your first waking thoughts: "how am i supposed to pee with this thing?" Your best physical feature: my chest bowl Your most missed memory: swimming at my grandma's house LAYER FOUR: Pepsi or Coke: pepsi McDonald's or Burger King: neither Single or group dates: group Adidas or Nike: neither Lipton Ice Tea or Nestea: nestea Chocolate or vanilla: vanilla Cappuccino or coffee: gross LAYER FIVE: Smoke: nope Cuss: constantly Sing: bad Take a shower everyday: rarely every day, at least three times a wekk Do you think you've been in love: i thought i was at one point but i wasn't Want to go to college: yes Liked high school: i like the years, but i hate school itself Want to get married: yes Believe in yourself: eh, sometimes Get motion sickness: nope Think you're attractive: you bet your bottom dollar i do Think you're a health freak: haha, no Get along with your parent(s): haha, no Like thunderstorms: oh yeah Play an instrument: guitar, bass LAYER SIX: In the past month... Drank alcohol: no Smoked: no Done a drug: nope Made Out: yep Gone on a date: yep Gone to the mall?: yes Eaten an entire box of Oreos?: nope Eaten sushi: no Been on stage: no Been dumped: no Gone skating: nope Made homemade cookies: i think so Gone skinny dipping: i don't think so, maybe two months ago Dyed your hair: nope Stolen Anything: yeah, i stole Les Miserables from my school's library LAYER SEVEN: Ever... Played a game that required removal of clothing: nope If so, was it mixed company: ... Been trashed or extremely intoxicated: nope Been caught "doing something": almost, because people don't knock Been called a tease: only by myself Gotten beaten up: yeah Shoplifted: oh yeah Changed who you were to fit in: probably in middle school LAYER EIGHT: Age you hope to be married: early to mid- 20s Numbers and Names of Children: 2 kids...Hoss and Rooster Describe your Dream Wedding: at Mandy's Chapel at Camp Weed How do you want to die: peacefully in my sleep Where do you want to go to college: i don't care What do you want to be when you grow up: a teacher What country would you most like to visit: England LAYER NINE: Number of drugs taken illegally: you name it, i've done it Number of people I could trust with my life: no one Number of CDs that I own: eh, some. i always get tired of the one's i have and get new ones Number of piercings: none Number of tattoos: 0 Number of times my name has appeared in the newspaper?: i don't think ever, besides when i turned 1 Number of scars on my body: just one on my forehead (no Harry Potter jokes, please) Number of things in my past that I regret: a lot

today was such a wonderful day. it was progress report day, and i didn't completely fail all of my classes. in fact, i had not even one D. i rock.

after school, me and Joey and Chase went to CCS to watch Chase's sister play volleyball. it was funny, because they suck so bad. then we went to Chiles to watch the girls play their V-ball game. they weren't much better than the middle school girls, but man...god bless volleyball.

then i peed on some guy's notebook.

i wrote a very lovely song for Amy. one of my best yet.

on another note, i want to bash the living crap out of my parents.
i have writer's block. i want to eat my head.

when i grow up a want a gigantic mansion, like in the movies, and i want a big library with floor-to-ceiling shelves filled with leather-bound, gold lettered books. and all day i'll read and learn new things. i was driving today and got to thinking about the phrase "knowledge is power." i realized knowledge is really what i desire most out of anything. i fear the day that i am not with you

Step 1: Open your Winamp or other lesser MP3 player.
Step 2: Put all of your music on random.
Step 3: Write down the first twenty songs it plays, no matter how embarrassing



1. F Your Sister - Steven Lynch
2. Lover's Rock - The Clash
3. Dog Without a Collar - The Locust
4. 24K - Since the Flood
5. Off the Wagon - The Get Up Kids
6. Broken Sound - A New Found Glory
7. Waitress - Live
8. Just Like Movie Stars - Matt Sharp
9. As Your Ghost Takes Flight - Saves the Day
10. Stumped - Minor Threat
11. What I See - Black Flag
12. Drive In, Drive Out - Dave Matthews Band
13. Let Us At Last Praise the Colonizers of Dreams - Shai Hulud
14. Lizzy - Ben Kweller
15. Jumping Around - The Rentals
16. Prosthetic Head - Green Day
17. (They Long to Be) Close to You - The Cranberries
18. Whatever's Going On - The Special Goodness
19. Today Your Love, Tomorrow the World - The Ramones
20. Fuck tha Police - NWA

change of plans...

instead of dropping out now and doing nothing, i'm going to do SAIL's GED exit option program. that pretty much means that in January, i'll be doing DCT instead of actually taking classes. this means that i'll get a SAIL diploma, and i'll be classified as a senior. that made me really happy when my guidance counselor told me that.

i'm hoping to work at Books-A-Million.

so now i just have to go through the motions until January. since i have to do that, i think i'm going to drop my science class, because i hate it with a fiery burning passion. if integrated science were an object, i would poop on it.

and then smear it.

my life is about to change. i'm dropping out of school to get my GED and also to get a job. i'm thinking i'd like to work at Books-A-Million. i really don't care where i work as long as it's not a restaraunt. man, i will never work at a restaraunt again.

i'm thinking i'd like to just drop out tomorrow and get a crap job for a month until i'm 18, then quit and get a good job and do the GED thang.

and i'd also really like to slap Jenni Garber.

or maybe pee on her.

i feel so happy right now. i'm living a simple life with no complications.

and it is good.

i'm totally NOT looking forward to going back to school. things were going pretty well all summer, but right when things start to get exciting, summer ends. same thing happened last summer too. but enough pouting.

i saw the new(er) Peter Pan tonight. freaking amazing. i don't care what anybody says, that movie rocks. oh yeah.

i borrowed my uncle's acoustic guitar, so i can start recording some of my songs that i've been working on this summer.

now go suck an egg.

things are going so good now.

tomorrow i'm leaving for Happening. this will be my first Happening, so i'm really excited. i keep asking my sister (who has been before) why she can't tell me anything about it. she keeps saying that it's a secret, and that i'll understand why she couldn't tell me when i get there. i can't wait to go. i'm already packed and everything.

what a geek.

today was spectacular. nothing out of the ordinary, it was just a great day. it was one of those days where you look back at what happened and the emotions you felt in the last 12 hours, and you think to yourself that you're glad to be alive.

first i went with Mike to EB in the mall and reserved a copy of GTA: San Andreas, and Mike bought this Nintendo thing that has like, 100 NES games on it. it's totally sweet. we to Wendy's and ate lunch and had some nice conversation. then we went back to his house and played video games for a while.

then i went to Amy's house and watched TV and made food and just chilled. man, i like this girl so much. she's coming over tomorrow to meet my mom and my friends and possibly (hopefully) my sister. i know they'll all like her.

g'day.

i love the way my life is going right now. i learned how to play "New Kid In Town" by The Eagles, and "Getting Into You" by Relient K. i'm really excited because those are two of my favorite songs in the whole wide world. i just need to learn how to sing better, because i sound like a scratched record when i sing.

GTA: San Andreas is coming out in October. i can't freaking wait. i'm getting a PS2 for my birthday. i got a gaming magazine that had an article on the new GTA, and it looks so sweet. i think i'm going to die before it comes out.

and Amy, she gets cuter every day.

i feel so good right now. i'm at one of those points where something bad just happened, but i just don't care anymore. i looked in the mirror and said, "self, stop wasting your time. it's not worth it," and i was fine. i've learned how to not worry about things that i have no control over. it feels good.

and besides, i think something good is about to happen, and her name is Amy.

i got back from Camp Weed today. i love the place and everyone there dearly, and i miss it already, but it's nice to be home. i'm looking forward to sleeping in my own bed. it's weird, but time seems to not exist when i'm there. you go there and stay for a week, and then you come back home and you've totally forgotten that you have a life away from there. it's like a coma, but a good one. i finally bought Dave Matthews Band - Crash tonight. i've been meaning to get it for a long time because i know that Haley likes them a lot, but i always forget when i go to a record store. i like it a lot. definitely something to listen to when i'm chillin'.

good news, everyone. i got a call from Chris Ford (the head counselor over at Camp Weed), and he wants me to come back on the 21st through the 27th and be a CIT again, because they are a man short for the next week. so of course i said...HECK YEAH! i was really hoping that this would happen.

on another note, i had this totally awesome dream, and i decided i'm going to write a book about it.
so yeah, i didn't know that wearing masks in public was illegal, but now i do.

tomorrow morning, bright and early, i go back to Camp Weed to be a CIT (Couselor In Training). here's a list of things i'm looking forward to: -bossing 14 year olds around -taking poops and stinking up the whole cabin -pooping in the girls cabins -making a totally awesome talent show movie -not having to clean -making new friends see you retards later. California by The Rentals i need your huggin' come here my east coast darlin' you must be last on the next flight you love the beautiful west side the beach and the gorgeous sunrise surfs up, the waves are rising high i'm all alone, i need you here in santa monica california from here to bell air the blue bus will take us everywhere everyone's happy everywhere 'til now from vita to el serrito seven years up and down the west coast surfs up the waves are rising high i'm all alone, i need you here in santa monica i'm all alone, why don't you come to santa monica california

i just got back from camp yesterday afternoon. it was sooooo rad.

highlights:
-winning the all camp relay
-getting last place in ace cabin
-coming in second place in the olympics
-making a totally rockin' talent show movie
-playing the penis song for my cabin
-the water balloon fight on the last night

this was definitely the most fun year i've had at camp. and you know what? the fun isn't over. i get to go back on Saturday and stay for a week as a CIT! WHOO!

yesterday i got a buttload of money for turning in some of my DVDs, so i bought some CDs:

The Ramones - Ramones
Black Flag - Damaged
The Clash - London Calling
Minor Threat - Complete Discography

i decided that it was time to start listening to some older stuff since what's coming out now is getting lamer and lamer.

speaking of lame, i saw Prisoner of Azkaban last night. if it wasn't based on a book, it would have been a totally sweet movie. don't get me wrong, i enjoyed it, but i thought that they changed too much stuff about it. like for instance, they didn't even mention that Harry's dad was part of the posse that created the Marauder's Map, which i thought was pretty important to the plot. eh, i whine too much.

and the chick who plays Hermione is totally hott.

yeah, so i managed to pass 10th grade. it only took me two years.

and i still love my shoes.
i bought a pair of white high top converse. they're so freaking tacky, but i'm the coolest kid on the block.

today the whole school took a field trip to some lake. it was pretty fun. i totally kicked some patooter in volleyball, while talking some serious trash the whole time. good times. then, Blake took his shoes back. so now i have no shoes, because i gave all of my other shoes to goodwill. David let me borrow his sandals until Monday, which was really nice of him. and i think i totally creeped Jessie out. i found out what it takes to be a man but mom and dad will never understand

man, it's been a while since i've updated. not because i've neglected to do it, but because i haven't been near a computer since my last entry. i'm in one of the computer labs right now, and it's so freaking cold.

i seriously have no idea what to write. nothing interesting has happened since my last entry, so i guess i'll just end it.

"smell ya later, retards." -C.W.
being a teenager definitely has its moments.
"Tarzan Boy" by Baltimora inspires me to do great things.
i know i'll be describing you to a therapist one day soon.

today really SUCKED.

i mean, i've had worse days. what made it so terrible was that i was so freaking bored. all i did was watch movies and read books. i had a nice, hour long break from that to talk to Jenni on the phone, but then got right back to it. 

i was supposed to go bowling with Sean and Micah, but of course, my mom said no because i was sick two days ago. man, she pisses me off sometimes.

i washed my hair today for the first time since February. cool, eh?

man, being sick sucks.

i want to go play basketball.

this weekend reached number 5 in my "Top Five Greatest Weekends" list. it was awesome. tomorrow begins Intensive Week, which i am sorta looking forward to, but also dreading because i'm so out of shape. umm... pooty. the stillness of a corpse is unnerving it is the physical form of death
you know what's lame? when your son has a 3.0 GPA and you don't even smile when he shows you his progress report.
